verses.verse: And the word <S%H1697><s%> of the LORD <S%H3068><s%> came <S%H1961><s%> unto <S%H413><s%> Jonah <S%H3124><s%> the second time, <S%H8145><s%> saying, <S%H559><s%>

Arise, <S%H6965><s%> go <S%H1980><s%> unto <S%H413><s%> Nineveh, <S%H5210><s%> that great <S%H1419><s%> city, <S%H5892><s%> and preach <S%H7121><s%> unto <S%H413><s%> it <S%H853><s%> the preaching <S%H7150><s%> that <S%H834><s%> I <S%H595><s%> bid <S%H1696><s%> <S%H413><s%> thee.

So Jonah <S%H3124><s%> arose, <S%H6965><s%> and went <S%H1980><s%> unto <S%H413><s%> Nineveh, <S%H5210><s%> according to the word <S%H1697><s%> of the LORD. <S%H3068><s%> Now Nineveh <S%H5210><s%> was <S%H1961><s%> an exceeding <S%H430><s%> great <S%H1419><s%> city <S%H5892><s%> of three <S%H7969><s%> days' <S%H3117><s%> journey. <S%H4109><s%>

And Jonah <S%H3124><s%> began <S%H2490><s%> to enter <S%H935><s%> into the city <S%H5892><s%> a <S%H259><s%> day's <S%H3117><s%> journey, <S%H4109><s%> and he cried, <S%H7121><s%> and said, <S%H559><s%> Yet <S%H5750><s%> forty <S%H705><s%> days, <S%H3117><s%> and Nineveh <S%H5210><s%> shall be overthrown. <S%H2015><s%>

So the people <S%H376><s%> of Nineveh <S%H5210><s%> believed <S%H539><s%> God, <S%H430><s%> and proclaimed <S%H7121><s%> a fast, <S%H6685><s%> and put on <S%H3847><s%> sackcloth, <S%H8242><s%> from the greatest <S%H4480><s%> <S%H1419><s%> of them even to <S%H5704><s%> the least <S%H6996><s%> of them.

For word <S%H1697><s%> came <S%H5060><s%> unto <S%H413><s%> the king <S%H4428><s%> of Nineveh, <S%H5210><s%> and he arose <S%H6965><s%> from his throne, <S%H4480><s%> <S%H3678><s%> and he laid <S%H5674><s%> his robe <S%H155><s%> from <S%H4480><s%> <S%H5921><s%> him, and covered <S%H3680><s%> him with sackcloth, <S%H8242><s%> and sat <S%H3427><s%> in <S%H5921><s%> ashes. <S%H665><s%>

And he caused it to be proclaimed <S%H2199><s%> and published <S%H559><s%> through Nineveh <S%H5210><s%> by the decree <S%H4480><s%> <S%H2940><s%> of the king <S%H4428><s%> and his nobles, <S%H1419><s%> saying, <S%H559><s%> Let neither <S%H408><s%> man <S%H120><s%> nor beast, <S%H929><s%> herd <S%H1241><s%> nor flock, <S%H6629><s%> taste <S%H2938><s%> any thing: <S%H3972><s%> let them not <S%H408><s%> feed, <S%H7462><s%> nor <S%H408><s%> drink <S%H8354><s%> water: <S%H4325><s%>

But let man <S%H120><s%> and beast <S%H929><s%> be covered <S%H3680><s%> with sackcloth, <S%H8242><s%> and cry <S%H7121><s%> mightily <S%H2394><s%> unto <S%H413><s%> God: <S%H430><s%> yea, let them turn <S%H7725><s%> every one <S%H376><s%> from his evil <S%H7451><s%> way, <S%H4480><s%> <S%H1870><s%> and from <S%H4480><s%> the violence <S%H2555><s%> that <S%H834><s%> is in their hands. <S%H3709><s%>

Who <S%H4310><s%> can tell <S%H3045><s%> if God <S%H430><s%> will turn <S%H7725><s%> and repent, <S%H5162><s%> and turn away <S%H7725><s%> from his fierce <S%H4480><s%> <S%H2740><s%> anger, <S%H639><s%> that we perish <S%H6><s%> not? <S%H3808><s%>

And God <S%H430><s%> saw <S%H7200><s%> <S%H853><s%> their works, <S%H4639><s%> that <S%H3588><s%> they turned <S%H7725><s%> from their evil <S%H7451><s%> way; <S%H4480><s%> <S%H1870><s%> and God <S%H430><s%> repented <S%H5162><s%> of <S%H5921><s%> the evil, <S%H7451><s%> that <S%H834><s%> he had said <S%H1696><s%> that he would do <S%H6213><s%> unto them; and he did <S%H6213><s%> it not. <S%H3808><s%>
